item.title: SEND IN THE DRONES
item.description:
SEND IN THE DRONES

Whether it's advertising or your next summer vacation video, drone photography is set to change how you see everything.

item.title: Here comes the boom
item.description:
Here comes the boom

 When photographer Iwan Zwarts was in South Africa recently, he was able to frame shots like never before. Instead of wandering around for hours, looking to set up his tripod and frame the landscape for a unique composition, he was now getting shots that would’ve been impossible before in a fraction of the time.

item.title: Perspective of God
item.description:
Perspective of God

Both Zwarts and Kneale see it as just a matter of time before drones become ubiquitous. "We’re on the verge of a boom much like the GoPro," says Zwarts. "You’ll just see it more and more, in movies, commercials, everywhere. The application possibilities are phenomenal." Kneale agrees that a boom is imminent and takes his prediction one step further. "It’s coming," says Kneale. "I guarantee the Christmas after next it will be the hot gift for everyone. Then everyone will get pissed off. It will be a social experiment."
